SEARCH
Package controller

Class MainViewController

java.lang.Object
controller.MainViewController
public class MainViewController extends Object
Controller class for managing toy inventory operations in the MainView.fxml interface.

This controller handles user interactions related to:

  • Adding new toys to the inventory.
  • Searching and filtering toys based on various criteria (e.g., serial number, name, type).
  • Buying toys from the inventory, including decrementing stock counts.
  • Removing toys from the inventory.

All operations interact with a toy inventory represented as a List<Toy>, which is loaded from and persisted to a file.

UI elements such as buttons, ComboBoxes, and text fields are connected using JavaFX @FXML annotations.

Version:
3.0
Author:
Justin Serrano
See Also:
  • Toy
  • Figures
  • Animals
  • Puzzles
  • BoardGames

  • Constructor Details

    • MainViewController

      public MainViewController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller, loads toy data, and sets up event listeners.

      This method is invoked when the FXML view is loaded. It initializes the toy inventory, configures UI components, and sets up listeners for user interactions.

    • loadData

      private void loadData()
      Loads toy data from the `toys.txt` file.

      This method reads data from the file specified by FILE_PATH and parses each line into a Toy object. If the file does not exist, a new file is created. Any errors encountered during parsing are logged to the console.

    • createNewFile

      private void createNewFile(File file)
      Creates a new file if it does not exist.
      Parameters:
      file - The file to create.

    • parseFileData

      private void parseFileData(File file)
      Parses the toy data from the file and adds valid toys to the inventory.

      Each line in the file is parsed into a Toy object using parseToy(String). Invalid lines are logged to the console.

      Parameters:
      file - The file containing toy data.

    • parseToy

      private Toy parseToy(String line)
      Parses a single line of toy data and returns the corresponding Toy object.
      Parameters:
      line - The line of toy data.
      Returns:
      The parsed Toy object, or null if parsing fails.

    • resetUI

      private void resetUI()
      Resets all UI components in the view to their initial state.

      This includes clearing all input fields, resetting labels, and disabling certain components until user interactions make them relevant.

    • setupComboBoxOptions

      private void setupComboBoxOptions()
      Sets up options for ComboBoxes used in the UI.

    • setupRadioButtonListener

      private void setupRadioButtonListener()
      Sets up radio button listeners to toggle the search options.

    • updateUIBasedOnType

      private void updateUIBasedOnType(String type)
      Updates the UI based on the selected toy type.
      Parameters:
      type - The selected toy type.

    • searchListener

      void searchListener(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action events triggered by the Search tab buttons: Search, Buy, and Clear.

      This method performs different actions depending on the source of the event:

      • Search Button: Validates inputs based on selected search criteria (e.g., serial number, name, or type) and populates the ListView with search results.
      • Buy Button: Invokes buySearch() to handle the purchase of a selected toy.
      • Clear Button: Resets all UI components to their initial state using resetUI().

      Validation errors or unexpected issues are caught and displayed in the search result label.

      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the user's interaction with the Search tab.
      See Also:
      • validateSerialNumber(String, String)
      • populateListView(List)
      • searchBySerialNumber(String)
      • searchByName(String)
      • searchByType(String)
      • buySearch()
      • resetUI()

    • populateListView

      private void populateListView(List<Toy> toys)
      Populates the ListView with the results of a toy search.

      This method clears the ListView and updates it with the provided list of toys. If the list is empty, a "No results found" message is displayed.

      Parameters:
      toys - The list of toys to display in the ListView.

    • searchBySerialNumber

      private List<Toy> searchBySerialNumber(String serialNumber)
      Searches toys by serial number.
      Parameters:
      serialNumber - The serial number to search.
      Returns:
      A list of toys matching the serial number.

    • searchByName

      private List<Toy> searchByName(String toyName)
      Searches toys by name.
      Parameters:
      toyName - The name to search.
      Returns:
      A list of toys matching the name.

    • searchByType

      private List<Toy> searchByType(String type)
      Searches toys by type.
      Parameters:
      type - The type to search.
      Returns:
      A list of toys matching the type.

    • filterToys

      private List<Toy> filterToys(Predicate<Toy> predicate, String noMatchMessage)
      Filters toys using a predicate and updates the result label if no matches are found.
      Parameters:
      predicate - The condition to filter toys.
      noMatchMessage - The message to display if no matches are found.
      Returns:
      A list of toys matching the predicate.

    • buySearch

      private void buySearch()
      Handles the logic for buying a toy from the ListView.

      This method checks if a toy is selected from the ListView, confirms the purchase with the user, decrements the available count of the toy, and updates the inventory. If the toy's stock reaches zero, it is removed from the inventory.

    • showBuyConfirmationDialog

      private boolean showBuyConfirmationDialog(Toy toy)
      Displays a confirmation dialog to confirm the purchase of the selected toy.
      Parameters:
      toy - The selected toy to be purchased.
      Returns:
      true if the user confirms the purchase, false otherwise.

    • addListener

      void addListener(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action events triggered by the Add tab buttons: Add and Clear.

      This method determines the source of the event and performs the appropriate action:

      • If the Add button is clicked:
        • Validates the input fields, including type-specific fields such as serial number, classification, size, puzzle type, or player range.
        • Creates a new Toy object based on the selected type and the provided input.
        • Adds the created toy to the inventory and updates the result label.
      • If the Clear button is clicked:
        • Resets all input fields and UI components to their initial state by invoking resetUI().

      Validation errors, unexpected issues, or invalid inputs are caught and displayed in the Add result label.

      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the user's interaction with the Add tab.
      See Also:
      • validateSerialNumber(String, String)
      • validateComboBoxSelection(ComboBox, String)
      • parsePositiveDouble(String, String)
      • parsePositiveInt(String, String)
      • resetUI()

    • validateComboBoxSelection

      private <T> T validateComboBoxSelection(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<T> comboBox, String fieldName)
      Validates that a ComboBox selection is not null and returns the selected value.
      Parameters:
      comboBox - The ComboBox to validate.
      fieldName - The name of the field for error messages.
      Returns:
      The selected value from the ComboBox.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the ComboBox selection is null.

    • validateSerialNumber

      private void validateSerialNumber(String serialNumber, String toyType)
      Validates a serial number for correct format and toy-specific rules.
      Parameters:
      serialNumber - The serial number to validate.
      toyType - The type of toy (optional, null for general validation).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the serial number is invalid.

    • parsePositiveInt

      private int parsePositiveInt(String input, String fieldName) throws NegativeNumberException
      Parses a positive integer from the input string.
      Parameters:
      input - The input string to parse.
      fieldName - The name of the field for error messages.
      Returns:
      A positive integer.
      Throws:
      NegativeNumberException - if the value is negative.
      NumberFormatException - if the input is not a valid integer.

    • parsePositiveDouble

      private double parsePositiveDouble(String input, String fieldName) throws NegativeNumberException
      Parses a positive double value from the given input string.
      Parameters:
      input - The input string to parse.
      fieldName - The name of the field (used for error messages).
      Returns:
      The parsed positive double value.
      Throws:
      NegativeNumberException - if the parsed value is negative.
      NumberFormatException - if the input string is not a valid number.

    • removeListener

      void removeListener(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action events triggered by the Remove tab buttons: Search, Remove, and Clear.

      This method determines the source of the event and performs the appropriate action:

      • Search Button: Validates the serial number input, searches for toys matching the serial number, and displays the results in the ListView. If the serial number is invalid or no matches are found, an error message is displayed.
      • Remove Button: Removes the selected toy from the ListView and the inventory. The removal operation requires user confirmation via a dialog box. If the removal is confirmed, the toy is deleted; otherwise, the operation is canceled.
      • Clear Button: Resets all input fields, labels, and UI components in the Remove tab to their initial state by invoking resetUI().

      Validation errors and unexpected issues are caught and displayed in the Remove result label.

      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the user's interaction with the Remove tab.
      See Also:
      • validateSerialNumber(String, String)
      • handleRemoveSearch()
      • handleRemoveToy()
      • resetUI()

    • handleRemoveSearch

      private void handleRemoveSearch()
      Searches for toys to remove based on the serial number.

      This method validates the serial number input, filters the toy inventory for matches, and updates the ListView with the results. If no matches are found, an error message is displayed.

    • handleRemoveToy

      private void handleRemoveToy()
      Removes the selected toy from the inventory.

      This method checks if a toy is selected in the ListView and prompts the user with a confirmation dialog. If confirmed, the toy is removed from both the inventory and the ListView. If the user cancels the operation, no action is taken.

    • showConfirmationDialog

      private boolean showConfirmationDialog(Toy toy)
      Displays a confirmation dialog to confirm the removal of the selected toy.
      Parameters:
      toy - The selected toy to be removed.
      Returns:
      true if the user confirms the removal, false otherwise.

    • updateData

      private void updateData()
      Saves the current list of toys to the `toys.txt` file.

      This method iterates over the `toys` list and writes each toy's data to the file in a format suitable for reloading. It ensures that any changes made to the inventory during the program's runtime are persisted to the file.

      If an error occurs while writing to the file, it is caught and logged to the console.

      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while writing to the file. The exception is caught internally and logged to the console.
      See Also:
      • Toy.toDataString()

    • showExitConfirmation

      public void showExitConfirmation(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Displays a confirmation dialog asking the user whether they want to save changes before exiting the application.

      This method provides three options:

      • Save and Exit: Saves the current list of toys to the `toys.txt` file and exits the application.
      • Exit Without Saving: Exits the application without saving any changes.
      • Cancel: Cancels the exit operation and keeps the application open.

      If the user chooses "Save and Exit," this method invokes updateData() to save the changes. If the user selects "Exit Without Saving," the application closes without saving. If the user selects "Cancel," the application remains open, and no further action is taken.

      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The main stage of the application. This is required to properly close the window when the user confirms exit.
      See Also:
      • updateData()

    • getToys

      public List<Toy> getToys()
      Returns the current list of toys in the inventory.

      This method provides access to the underlying List<Toy> used to manage the toy inventory. It is primarily intended for testing or external access to the inventory data.

      Returns:
      A List<Toy> representing the current inventory of toys.
